chapter.title: Managing Dive Logs
chapter.para: &product; supports the following methods of adding dive data to a logbook. Dive logs can be:

listitem.para: Dives recorded in written logbooks can be manually entered by hand.

Dives recorded using spreadsheet programs can be exported to CSV file format. Provided that each record in the spreadsheet represents a single dive, it may be possible to import the dive logs assuming the delimetered fields can be mapped.
Proprietary software distributed by dive computer manufacturers

sect1.title: Manually Creating Dive Logs
sect1.para: This approach works well for dives done with without a dive computer. The basic record of information within &productshort; is a dive. While &productshort; can store much more information for each dive, the most important information in a simple dive logbook usually includes:

listitem.para: dive type
date
time
duration
depth
name of your dive buddy
name of the divemaster or dive guide
remarks about the dive

sect1.para: There are two main tasks to perform when manually creating divelogs:

sect2.title: Enter Dive Information
sect2.para: Entering dive information is as simple as completing the fields on the the &paneldiveinfo; panel Notes and Equipment tabs.

orderedlist.title: To add a new dive to a logbook:

listitem.para: Open the logbook you want to add the dive to.
Select Log Add dive from the Main Menu.
A new dive is started and is in edit mode.
In the &paneldiveinfo; panel complete the fields in the Notes tab.
In the &paneldiveinfo; panel complete the fields in the Equipment tab.
Click the Apply changes button to update the dive information in memory.

sect1.title: Viewing Dive Logs
sect1.para: The &paneldivelist; panel lists the dive logs in an open logbook. Each dive log is a record in the &paneldivelist;. Dive logs can selected using the mouse pointer and clicking a record or using the UP and DOWN keys on the keyboard.

sect2.title: Selecting Multiple Dive Logs
sect2.para: It is possible to select multiple records, consecutively and non-consecutively, using the mouse or keyboard.

orderedlist.title: Selecting multiple consecutive records using the mouse:

listitem.para: Point and click a record.
The record will be highlighted showing it is selected.
Hold down the Shift key on the keyboard.
Point and click a record above or below the currently selected record.
The records between and including the clicked records will be highlighted showing they are selected.

orderedlist.title: Selecting multiple non-consecutive records using the mouse:

listitem.para: Point and click a record.
The record will be highlighted showing it is selected.
Hold down the CTRL key on the keyboard.
Point and click a record above or below the currently selected record.
Only the records you click on will be highlighted showing they are selected.
